title: Chocolate Lava Cake
subtitle: This lava cake is the first lava cake to have the perfect gooey center that I am always craving. It is not too sweet and has a decadent chocolate taste.
subtitle2: This recipe comes together fairly quickly and is always a show stopper when serving to guests. The center is perfectly molten and the cake has a nice strong chocolate flavor. The olive oil has a subtle flavor that works well with the chocolate making this recipe unique.
steps: Prepare !mold by spreading a thick layer of butter. Make sure to get in all the crevices. My tins were ceramic mini bundt cake molds. Then dust all of the tins with flour and tap out excess flour.
Place a ^steel bowl$ on top of a ^saucepan$ with simmer watering to create a double boiler. Place the chocolate and oil in the bowl. Melt until completely smooth. Then remove from heat and set aside.
Add the whole eggs, egg yolks, sugar, and salt into a ^medium bowl$. Beat using a ^hand mixer$ until the mixture is very pale, thick, and has doubled in volume. This should take around 2 minutes.
Add in the vanilla extract, and flour while beating. Beat until just combined.
Drizzle the egg mixture into the chocolate mixture while beating on low. The mixture should thicken. Beat until just combined.
Pour the mixture equally into all of the molds. Place the molds onto a ^sheet tray$ for easy transportation.
Bake the molds for 15 minutes or until the cakes have puffed, have a matte top, and still have a slightly molten center.
Invert the molds onto a plate, and serve immediately. Top with whipped cream or ice cream.
